definition[0]: orthodox ideas, methods, or behaviour are accepted by most people to be correct and right
example[1]: He challenged the orthodox views on education.
definition[1]: someone who is orthodox has the opinions and beliefs that are generally accepted as being right, and does not have new or different ideas
example[2]: Orthodox economists believe that a recession is now inevitable.
definition[2]: believing in all the traditional beliefs, laws, and practices of a religion
